src:
FOTO: Selusin Ruang 'Selfie' di Cologne
06 Nov 2019, 15:08 by AFP Photo, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia
Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Pameran 25 ruangan selfie di Cologne, Jerman, berlangsung hingga 2 Februari 2020.


Pameran 'Supercandy Pop-Up Museum' kembali digelar di Cologne, Jerman, pada bulan ini. (AFP/Ina Fassbender)



Di area seluas 2.000 meter persegi, pameran ini menghadirkan 25 ruangan untuk selfie. (AFP/Ina Fassbender)



Seluruh ruangan bisa dinikmati oleh pengunjung dari segala kalangan dan usia. (AFP/Ina Fassbender)



Pameran ini buka mulai 1 November 2019 sampai 2 Februari 2020 setiap hari, mulai dari Senin sampai Minggu. (AFP/Ina Fassbender)



Harga tiket masuk ke pameran ini 19.90 euro (sekitar Rp300 ribu) per orang. (AFP/Ina Fassbender)



Dalam sekali kedatangan, pengunjung hanya diperbolehkan menjelajah ruangan selama dua jam. (AFP/Ina Fassbender)



Pengunjung berpose dalam ruangan yang dihiasi balon serba pink. (AFP/Ina Fassbender)



Pengunjung dipersilakan menggunakan kostum sehingga foto semakin terlihat menarik. (AFP/Ina Fassbender)
text:
PHOTOS: A dozen 'Selfie' Spaces in Cologne
06 Nov 2019, 15:08 by AFP Photo, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia
Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Exhibition of 25 selfie rooms in Cologne, Germany, lasts until February 2, 2020.


The 'Supercandy Pop-Up Museum' exhibition will be held again in Cologne, Germany, this month. (AFP / Ina Fassbender)



In an area of 2,000 square meters, this exhibition presents 25 rooms for selfies. (AFP / Ina Fassbender)



The entire room can be enjoyed by visitors of all walks of life and ages. (AFP / Ina Fassbender)



The exhibition is open from 1 November 2019 to 2 February 2020 every day, from Monday to Sunday. (AFP / Ina Fassbender)



The price of admission to the exhibition is 19.90 euros (around Rp. 300 thousand) per person. (AFP / Ina Fassbender)



On one arrival, visitors are only allowed to roam the room for two hours. (AFP / Ina Fassbender)



Visitors pose in a room decorated with pink balloons. (AFP / Ina Fassbender)



Visitors are welcome to use costumes so the photos look more attractive. (AFP / Ina Fassbender)
